text: BANGKOK, Jan 12 Thailand has approved more measures to mitigate the impact of the coronavirus pandemic after a recent outbreak in the country, including soft loans and reducing utility bills, Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha said on Tuesday.Electricity and water will be subsided until March, Prayuth told a briefing, and Internet prices will also be supported to promote working from home. Low interest loans will be available for business owners, while further measures of a monthly 3,500 baht ($116) per person will be considered next week. ($1 = 30.1500 baht) (Reporting by Panarat Thepgumpanat, Satawasin Staporncharnchai and Chayut Setboonsarng; Editing by Martin Petty)
